hierarchy.name: Intersect MBO Hierarchy (as of Feb 2026)
hierarchy.description: Marketed as community-led, but members only directly elect committee seats and 2 of 4 board seats. Board appoints ED. Founding entities (IOG, EMURGO) retain 2 appointed board seats. Committees are advisory — on-chain DReps/CC hold final ratification power.

children.name: Members (1,800 paid / 2,700 associates)
children.details: Vote on committee seats (biannual) and 2 of 4 board seats. Cannot elect ED, staff, or ISC members. On-chain governance (DReps) is separate from Intersect membership. 19.4% turnout in Oct 2025 election.
children.decision_power: Limited — elect committees + 2 board seats only
children.how_work_done: Discussions, events, proposals. Actual power is indirect: elect committees who propose, then DReps ratify on-chain.
children.transparency_note: Intersect markets this as 'ultimate' power, but members do not control board composition (50% appointed), ED hiring, staff, or budget execution.

children.name: Board of Directors
children.details: Governing body; strategic oversight, appoints ED, sets direction. Only 2 of 4 seats are member-elected. Founding entities (IOG, EMURGO) hold the other 2 seats.
children.decision_power: High — appoints ED, sets strategy. 50% appointed by founding entities.
children.how_work_done: Meetings, executive sessions. No public minutes. Board decisions are not subject to member vote.
children.transparency_note: Claim of 'majority member-elected by 2026' is aspirational — no confirmed timeline. Current structure gives founding entities veto-level influence.

children.name: Executive Director
children.details: Leads ops/governance; reports to board. Appointed by board — not elected by members.
children.decision_power: High — strategic/budget facilitation. Board-appointed, not member-elected.
children.how_work_done: Coordinates staff/committees. Hiring decisions not disclosed publicly.

children.name: Intersect Steering Committee (ISC)
children.details: Composed of committee chairs + 2 elected seats + admin leads. Not directly elected by members as a body — chairs come from committee elections, admin leads are appointed.
children.decision_power: High — collective decisions, but composition is mostly internal.
children.how_work_done: Supports development; all committees report here. Minutes not consistently public.
children.transparency_note: Only 2 ISC seats are directly elected. Remaining seats are ex-officio (chairs) or appointed (admin leads).

children.name: Standing Committees (Member-Elected, Report to ISC)
children.details: 7 committees; biannual elections (50% seats per cycle). This is the primary level where members actually elect representatives. Committees propose solutions and form WGs, but final decisions go through on-chain governance.
children.decision_power: Medium — advisory/proposals. This is where member elections actually matter.
children.how_work_done: Meetings (some public minutes), discussions, WGs for tasks. Only OSC has public YouTube recordings.

children.name: Technical Steering Committee (TSC)
children.details: Tech upgrades, params, incidents. Includes Parameters Subcommittee.

children.name: Working Groups (Ad-Hoc, Report to Committees)
children.details: Hands-on tasks, proposals. Created by committees/members.

children.name: Staff/Support (Report to ED)
children.details: Ops, people, tech advisors. Hired by ED/board — no member input on hiring. Facilitate, not decide (officially).
children.decision_power: Low (officially) — but staff control day-to-day ops, meeting agendas, and information flow.
children.how_work_done: Daily ops, coordination. No public org chart or team page (404).
children.transparency_note: No salaries disclosed. Team page returns 404. Hiring process opaque.

gaps: Members only elect committee seats + 2 of 4 board seats — not ED, staff, ISC admin leads, or secretaries.
50% of board seats are founding-entity appointed (IOG, EMURGO) — not member-elected.
No salaries/stipends disclosed for any role.
Election turnout critically low (19.4% Oct 2025) — governance legitimacy concern.
Full 2026 elections pending — no confirmed date.
ED hiring process not disclosed — appointed by partially-appointed board.
